January 2, 1977: Fiction
TRINITY, by Leon Uris. (Doubleday, $10.95.) One family's meander through a
century of modern Irish history.
SLEEPING MURDER, by Agatha Christie. (Dodd, Mead, $7.95.) Miss Marple's
last case; Agatha's last book.
STORM WARNING, by Jack Higgins. (Holt, Rinehart & Winston, $8.95.) Salty
WWII adventure of Nazis at sea.
SLAPSTICK, by Kurt Vonnegut. (Delacorte, $7.95.) Whimsical, futuristic fantasy
about a pediatrician President, etc.
RAISE THE TITANIC!, by Clive Cussler. (Viking, $8.95.) Thriller about doing just
that.
CEREMONY OF THE INNOCENT, by Taylor Caldwell. (Doubleday, $10.95.)
Caldwell in top storytelling form, heavier on the ideology.
TOUCH NOT THE CAT, by Mary Stewart. (Morrow, $8.95.) Heady brew of
mystery, occult, and romance.
MARRY ME, by John Updike. (Knopf, $7.95.) Extra-marital love in suburbia c.
1962; dreamy Updike.
DOLORES, by Jacqueline Susann. (Morrow, $6.95.) Fanzine stuff about a
widowed First Lady.
THE CRASH OF '79, by Paul E. Erdman. (Simon & Schuster, $8.95.) Sheiks, oil,
International intrigue and skullduggery.
January 2, 1977
Non-Fiction
ROOTS, by Alex Haley. (Doubleday, $12.50.) One man's family and an important
document of Black History.
PASSAGES, by Gail Sheehy. (Dutton, $9.95.) Help for adults undergoing
developmental crises.
BLIND AMBITION, by John W. Dean III. (Simon & Schuster, $11.95.) Surprisingly
informative, lively "inside Watergate" memoirs.
THE GRASS IS ALWAYS GREENER OVER THE SEPTIC TANK, by Erma
Bombeck. (McGraw-Hill, $6.95.) Suburban humor by the columnist.
YOUR ERRONEOUS ZONES, by Dr. Wayne W. Dyer. (Funk & Wagnalls, $6.95.)
Breezy self-help pep talk.
ADOLF HITLER, by John Toland. (Doubleday, $14.95.) Immensely detailed life of
the Fuehrer, replete with new and interesting information.
THE HITE REPORT, by Shere Hite. (Macmillian, $12.50.) Groundbreaking
interviews with women on sex.
THE RIGHT AND THE POWER, by Leon Jaworski. (Reader's Digest Press/Gulf
Publishing Co., $9.95.) The former Watergate special prosecutor's account.
TO JERUSALEM AND BACK, by Saul Bellow. (Viking, $8.95.) Brilliant vignettes of
encircled but alive Nobel Prize-winner.
BLOOD AND MONEY, by Thomas Thompson. (Doubleday, $10.95.) Fascinating
true-crime account of some Texas murders.
